thread.title: Man trapped in NSW dam for hours
thread.title_full: Man trapped in NSW dam for hours

title: Man trapped in NSW dam for hours
text: Share this article Share 'He was trapped such that only just a part of his face was above the water, just his nose and his forehead was above the water,' Inspector Neil Stephens said. Water was pumped out of the dam by fire crews before Mr Miller was pulled free. He was taken to John Hunter Hospital via helicopter suffering hypothermia and back injuries. Mr Miller was pulled from the mud, where he struggled to free his mouth to call for help Fire and Rescue crews from Forster were first on the scene to free Mr Miller from the mud The fire and rescue crew said the machine needed to be pulled off Mr Miller before he could be freed Forster Fire and Rescue crew were first on scene at the Charlotte Bay property to pull Mr Miller from the mud. The crew said they needed 'a variety of equipment' to safely free him including 'crib blocks, a tirfor winch and power hydraulic tools. They said the machine also needed to be pulled off Mr Miller before they could free him. 'Cheers everyone,' the team wrote on its Facebook page on Wednesday. He spent two hours with only his face above the muddy water before a neighbour heard his cries for help Mr Miller was taken to John Hunter Hospital suffering hypothermia and back injuries Ambulance and fire rescue crews were all on scene at the Charlotte Bay property Water was pumped out of the dam by fire crews before Mr Miller was pulled free 'These two were never getting back in the truck looking like that,' the crew posted alongside this photo of two of its members The fire and rescue team were called to the Charlotte Bay property where they had to pull the machine off Mr Miller before they were able to safely free him from the mud Read more: Share or comment on this article 116
